### Snow Removal and Ice Control Services for E&I & SAR Building at St. Anthony, NL

**Solicitation No.**: 30003136
**Project No.**: PW-22-01014830
**Amendment No.**: 0

**Notice Type**: Competitive RFx (Request for Proposal)
**Procurement Method**: Open Bidding
**Publication Date**: November 25, 2022
**Closing Date**: December 30, 2022 (13:00:00 NST)

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans, Canada is seeking a qualified contractor to provide Snow Removal and Ice Control Services for the E&I & SAR Building at St. Anthony, Newfoundland and Labrador.

**Objectives of the Requirement**

The successful contractor will be responsible for providing the necessary workforce, materials, and equipment to clear snow and ice, as well as spreading salt or a mixture of salt and sand to prevent slippery conditions on the access routes, parking areas, loading and unloading zones, and main entrances of the building. Additionally, the contractor must supply and install markers to identify the location of curved, planters, fire hydrants, valve boxes, catch basins, storm sewers, manholes, and other fixtures to prevent damage and maintain them in an accessible and workable condition.

**Scope of Work**

The scope of work includes:

* Snow removal
* Ice control
* Salt-spreading
* Marker installation
* Manual shoveling of entrances and building exits

The services will be delivered using heavy equipment, including a front-end loader, backhoe, or truck with a plow attachment. The contractor must provide pricing for the following services:

* Use of heavy equipment for snow removal (hourly rate)
* Use of a truck with a plow attachment for snow removal (hourly rate)
* Use of a loaded/bucket and tandem axle truck for snow removal from the site (hourly rate)
* Spreading of salt or a mixture of salt and sand (hourly rate)
* Cost of salt and sand supply and delivery to the site (per tonne)
* Manual shoveling of entrances and building exits (hourly rate)

**Contract Configuration**

The contract will be for a period of 1 year with three (3) option periods of one (1) year each. The contract will be awarded based on the submitted proposals.
